snippet: Beate Zschäpe is accused of ties to the National Socialist Underground, known for a series of killings, robberies and bombings. The case raises nagging questions about German law enforcement.
abstract: German prosecutors charge Beate Zschape, last surviving member of neo-Nazi terrorist cell National Socialist Underground, with murder after yearlong investigation into allegations that she had role in decade of killings, robberies and bombings; case raises questions about how group remained undiscovered for so long and why police persisted in searching for ties to Turkish organized crime instead of violent racists.

byline.contributor: Victor Homola and Chris Cottrell contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Beate Zschäpe is accused of ties to the National Socialist Underground, known for a series of killings, robberies and bombings. The case raises nagging questions about German law enforcement.

headline.seo: German Woman Charged Neo-Nazi Crime Rampage
headline.main: German Woman Charged in Neo-Nazi Crime Rampage
headline.print_headline: German Woman Charged in Neo-Nazi Crime Rampage
